description: From Old French imperfeccion. See im- +â€Ž perfection.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Those qualities or features that are imperfect; the characteristic, state, or quality of being imperfect.
examples: You can accept your imperfection or try to improve.

entries.meaning: (countable) Something that makes something else less than perfect; a blemish, impurity, error, etc.
examples: He loves me despite my imperfections.
